_comment: Created by ianb on 29/05/2014 14:46:29 using v2.1
title: How have breaches of the four hour target changed?
analysis_commentary: Overall, the proportion of people experiencing long waits (over four hours), for the total time spent in A&E , rose between November 2010 and May 2014. The 'total time' is how long the patient spent in A&E from arrival to when the patient leaves the department - to be admitted, transferred or discharged. The period between January and April 2013 saw particularly high levels of patients waiting over four hours - was 5.07% of all emergency admissions, compared with an overall average of 2.22% for the preceding 26 months. The proportion waiting over four hours then dropped sharply after April 2013 (from May 2013 to May 2014), with an average of 3.07% of emergency admissions waiting over four hours for a bed.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
